00038 /// @brief Creates a new Dabg object and inits it

00044 /// @brief               Creates a new Dabg object with space reserved.
00045 /// @param chip_cap      reserve space for this many chips
00046 /// @param intensity_cap reserve space for this many intensities per chip
00047 affx::Dabg::Dabg(int capacity)
00048 {
00049   clear();
00050   intensity_reserve(capacity);
00051 }
00052 
00053 /// @brief Initialize the object to empty.
00054 void
00055 affx::Dabg::clear()
00056 {
00057   is_prepared=0;
00058   m_GCCN_preprocessed = false;
00059 
00060   data.resize(AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX+2);
00061   for (int gcbin=0;gcbin<=AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX;gcbin++) {
00062     data[gcbin].clear();
00063   }
00064 }
00065 
00066 void affx::Dabg::GCCN_preprocessed (bool b)
00067 {
00068         m_GCCN_preprocessed = b;
00069 }

00071 /// @brief          reserve space for intensity values
00072 /// @param chip_idx the chip to reserve space for.
00073 void
00074 affx::Dabg::intensity_reserve(int capacity)
00075 {
00076   // capacity is the total number of probes
00077   // each gc_vector will have a fraction of the probes.
00078   int gcbin_capacity_guess;
00079   for (int gcbin=0;gcbin<=AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX;gcbin++) {
00080     // estimate capacitys for the bins.
00081     if ((gcbin<5)||(gcbin>19)) {
00082       gcbin_capacity_guess=capacity*0.0005;
00083     }
00084     else if ((gcbin<10)||(gcbin>16)) {
00085       gcbin_capacity_guess=capacity*0.0800;
00086     }
00087     else {
00088       gcbin_capacity_guess=capacity*0.1600;
00089     }
00090     //
00091     data[gcbin].reserve(gcbin_capacity_guess);
00092   }
00093 
00094   data[AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX+1].reserve(capacity);
00095 }
00096 
00097 size_t
00098 affx::Dabg::intensity_count(int gc_idx)
00099 {
00100   return data.at(gc_idx).size();
00101 }

00103 /// @brief     Copy the reservations from another dabg
00104 /// @param     dabg_from     Dabg to copy from
00105 void
00106 affx::Dabg::intensity_reserve_copy(affx::Dabg& dabg_from)
00107 {
00108   data.resize(AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX+2);
00109   for (int gcbin=0;gcbin<=AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX;gcbin++) {
00110     data[gcbin].reserve(dabg_from.data[gcbin].size());
00111   }
00112 }

00114 /// @brief add a vector of background intensities
00115 /// @param chip_idx      the index of the chip to add to
00116 /// @param gc_vec        a vector of gc content of the intensity values
00117 /// @param intensity_vec a vector of the intensity values 
00118 void
00119 affx::Dabg::add_intensitiy_vec(std::vector<int> gc_vec,std::vector<float> intensity_vec)
00120 {
00121   assert(gc_vec.size()==intensity_vec.size());
00122 
00123   is_prepared=0; // not ready
00124 
00125   uint32_t gc_vec_size=gc_vec.size();
00126   for (uint32_t i=0;i<gc_vec_size;i++) {
00127     data[gc_vec[i]].push_back(intensity_vec[i]);
00128   }
00129 }

00131 /// @brief             Add a single intensity
00132 /// @param chip_idx    the chip to add it to.
00133 /// @param gcbin       the gc value of this probe
00134 /// @param intensity   the intensity value of this probe
00135 void
00136 affx::Dabg::add_intensity(int gcbin,affx::Dabg::intensity_t intensity)
00137 {
00138   is_prepared=0; // not ready
00139   data[gcbin].push_back(intensity);
00140   data[AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX+1].push_back(intensity);
00141 }
00142 
00143 //! prepare this object for use.
00144 //! At the moment, this just means sorting the vectors.
00145 //! also see prepare_maybe in "Dabg.h"
00146 /// @brief   prepare the object for use (sort all the intensities)
00147 void 
00148 affx::Dabg::prepare()
00149 {
00150   // printf("PREPARE!!!\n"); // 
00151   for (uint32_t gcbin=0;gcbin<data.size();gcbin++) {
00152     sort(data[gcbin].begin(),data[gcbin].end());
00153   }
00154   is_prepared=1; // ready
00155 }
00156 
00157 /// @brief            Convert an intensity to a p-value
00158 /// @param chip       which chip to use
00159 /// @param gcbin      which gc bin the probe is in
00160 /// @param intensity  the intensity of the probe
00161 /// @return           the probablity that this p-value is above the background.
00162 /// @remark
00163 //! this is the left-tail probablity.  
00164 //! Prob=value is larger than all items to the left.
00165 //! vectors are sorted in increasing order.
00166 double
00167 affx::Dabg::intensity_to_pvalue(int gcbin,Dabg::intensity_t intensity)
00168 {
00169   double theval,pval;
00170   //Dabg::intensity_t val;
00171   // insure data is prepared (ie sorted)
00172   prepare_maybe();
00173 
00174   int l_idx;
00175   //int u_idx;
00176   l_idx=0;
00177 
00178   int icnt=data[gcbin].size();
00179   //printf("icnt=%d\n",icnt);
00180   // no values?
00181   if (icnt==0) {
00182     pval=0; // this will be inverted.
00183   } 
00184   // one value?
00185   else if (icnt==1) {
00186     theval=data[gcbin][0];
00187     if (intensity<theval) {
00188       pval=0.0; // perl dabg returns 1; we invert
00189     }
00190     else if (intensity>theval) {
00191       pval=1.0; // perl dabg returns 0; we invert
00192     }
00193     else {
00194       pval=0.5;
00195     }
00196   } 
00197   else {
00198     // l_idx is the index of the value ">=" intensity
00199     l_idx=std::lower_bound(data[gcbin].begin(),data[gcbin].end(),intensity)
00200       - data[gcbin].begin();
00201     // fix it up to be less than intensity
00202     if (l_idx==icnt) {
00203       l_idx=icnt-1;
00204     }
00205     pval=((double)l_idx)/((double)icnt);
00206   }
00207 
00208   // now that we have our pval, invert it for our chances of being greater.
00209   pval=(1.0-pval);
00210   
00211   //printf("dabg: intensity_to_pvalue(%2d,%2d,%8.4f)=%8.4f\n",chip,gcbin,intensity,pval);
00212   //printf("dabg: n=%3d : in=%3d : %10.6f : pos=%3d : val=%3d\n",
00213   //       (int)data[gcbin].size(),(int)intensity,pval,l_idx,(int)data[gcbin][l_idx]);
00214   return pval;
00215 }

00217 /// @brief       Dump the contents of the object
00218 /// @param level The level of verbosity
00219 /// @remark
00220 //! level=0: summary
00221 //! level=1: gcbins with sizes>0
00222 //! level=2: all gcbins
00223 //! level=3: all data
00224 void
00225 affx::Dabg::dump(int level)
00226 {
00227   printf("Dabg dump (%d) ==========\n",level);
00228 
00229   if (level==0) { return; }
00230 
00231   for (uint32_t gcbin=0;gcbin<data.size();gcbin++) {
00232     int v_size=(int)data[gcbin].size();
00233     int v_cap=(int)data[gcbin].capacity();
00234     if ((level>=2)||((level>=1)&&(v_size>0))) {
00235       printf("# data[gcbin=%2d]==%d/%d\n",gcbin,v_size,v_cap);
00236       if (level>=3) {
00237         for (uint32_t i=0;i<data[gcbin].size();i++) {
00238           printf("%3d: %f\n",i,(double)data[gcbin][i]);
00239         }
00240       }
00241     }
00242   }
00243 }

00247 /// @brief       Compute the targets and pvals for all the chips.
00248 /// @param probe_cnt   number of probes
00249 /// @param gc_arr      array of probe gc values
00250 /// @param pm_arr      array of probe pm intensities
00251 /// @param target_arr  output array of target probabilities
00252 /// @param pvalues_arr output array of probe probabilities
00253 //void
00254 //Dabg::rundabg(int probe_cnt,
00255 //              int* gc_arr,double** pm_arr,
00256 //              double* target_arr,double** pvalues_arr)
00257 //{
00258 //  for (int idx=0;idx<cel_cnt;idx++) {
00259 //    rundabg_idx(idx,probe_cnt,gc_arr,pm_arr[idx],&target_arr[idx],pvalues_arr[idx]);
00260 //  }
00261 //}
00262 
00263 /// @brief          Compute the target and pvals for one chip.
00264 /// @param chip_idx    Index of the chip
00265 /// @param probe_cnt   number of probes in set
00266 /// @param gc_arr      gc values of the probles
00267 /// @param pm_arr      pm intensity values of the probles
00268 /// @param target      Output: probability of the probset above background.
00269 /// @param pval_arr    Output: probability of the probe above background
00270 void
00271 affx::Dabg::compute_target_fisher(int probe_cnt,int* gc_arr,double* pm_arr,int dof_adjustment,
00272                                   double* out_target,double* out_pval_arr)
00273 {
00274   double pval_product;
00275 
00276   // fill pvalues_arr and compute product
00277   pval_product=0.0;
00278   for (int pi=0;pi<probe_cnt;pi++) {
00279     out_pval_arr[pi]=intensity_to_pvalue(gc_arr[pi],(affx::Dabg::intensity_t)pm_arr[pi]);
00280     pval_product=pval_product+log(out_pval_arr[pi]);
00281     //printf("dabg2: pi=%2d pm=%12.8f pval=%12.8f  product=%12.8f\n",pi,pm_arr[pi],pval[pi],pval_product);
00282   }
00283 
00284   /// @todo This should be replaced with a constant bias rather than a step function.
00285   if (pval_product==0.0) {
00286     pval_product=0.000001; // copied from perl
00287   }
00288   
00289   /// @todo  Why '-2*'?
00290   double test_statistic=-2*pval_product;
00291   *out_target=affxstat::chisqrprob(2*probe_cnt - dof_adjustment,(float)test_statistic);
00292   //printf("dabg2: test_statistic=%12.8f\n",test_statistic);
00293   //printf("dabg2: target=%12.8f\n",*target);
00294 }

00296 #ifndef min
00297 #define min(A,B) A<B?A:B
00298 #endif
00299 
00300 #ifndef max
00301 #define max(A,B) A>B?A:B
00302 #endif
00303 
00304 // GCOS algorithm
00305 inline double PercentileValue (std::vector<double> &values, const int numValues, const double percentile)
00306 {
00307         unsigned long valueBefore,valueAfter;
00308         double percentileIndex,fraction;
00309 
00310         percentileIndex=((double)numValues-1.0)* percentile;
00311         valueBefore =(unsigned long)percentileIndex;
00312         valueAfter = valueBefore + 1;
00313 
00314         // Bounds check on indices
00315         valueAfter=min(valueAfter,(unsigned long)(numValues-1));
00316         valueBefore=max(valueBefore,0);
00317 
00318         fraction = percentileIndex - valueBefore;
00319 
00320         double return_value = values[valueBefore] + fraction * (values[valueAfter] - values[valueBefore]);
00321 
00322         return return_value;
00323 }
00324 
00325 inline float lookup_percentile (float v, std::vector<float> &sorted_array)
00326 {
00327         int N = sorted_array.size ();
00328 
00329         // Not items yet, insert at beginning
00330         if (N == 0)
00331                 return 0.0F;
00332 
00333         // Greater or equal to the last item, insert at the end
00334         if (v > sorted_array[N-1])
00335                         1.0F;
00336 
00337         // Less than the first item, insert at the beginning
00338         if (v < sorted_array[0])
00339                 return 0.0F;
00340 
00341         // If the size is less than 5, use a linear search
00342         int  i;
00343 
00344         if (N < 6)
00345         {
00346                 for (i = 1; i < N-1; i++)
00347                 {
00348                         if (v <  sorted_array[i])
00349                                 return (float)i/(float)N;
00350                 }
00351 
00352                 return (float)i/(float)N;
00353         }
00354 
00355         // Use a binary search
00356         int istart,iend;
00357 
00358         istart = 0;
00359         iend = N-1;
00360         i = N / 2;
00361 
00362         while (1)
00363         {
00364                 if (v < sorted_array[i])
00365                         iend = i - 1;
00366                 else
00367                         istart = i + 1;
00368 
00369                 if (iend - istart < 4)
00370                 {
00371                         for (i = istart; i <= iend; i++)
00372                         {
00373                                 if (v < sorted_array[i])
00374                                         return (float)i/(float)N;
00375                         }
00376 
00377                         return (float)i/(float)N;
00378                 }
00379 
00380                 i = (iend - istart) / 2;
00381                 i += istart;
00382         }
00383 }

00385 //extern bool g_record_probe_values;
00386 
00387 void
00388 affx::Dabg::compute_target_percentile(int probe_cnt,int* gc_arr,double* pm_arr,
00389                                       double per_cut,
00390                                       double* out_target,double* out_pval_arr, 
00391                                                                           bool GCCN_preprocessed)
00392 {
00393     // in bounds
00394   assert(per_cut>=0.0);
00395   assert(per_cut<=1.0);
00396   //
00397   std::vector<double> pval_vec;
00398   pval_vec.reserve(probe_cnt);
00399 
00400   // fill pvalues_arr and compute product
00401   for (int pi=0;pi<probe_cnt;pi++) 
00402   {
00403                 // save one to return
00404                 int gc_count;
00405 
00406                 if (GCCN_preprocessed)
00407                 {
00408                         prepare_maybe ();
00409                         out_pval_arr[pi] = 1.0 - (double)lookup_percentile (pm_arr[pi],data[AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX+1]);
00410                 }
00411                 else
00412                         out_pval_arr[pi]=intensity_to_pvalue(gc_arr[pi],(affx::Dabg::intensity_t)pm_arr[pi]);
00413 
00414                 // save one to work with.
00415                 pval_vec.push_back(out_pval_arr[pi]);
00416 
00417                 //printf("pval_arr[%d]=%f\n",pi,out_pval_arr[pi]);
00418   }
00419 
00420   // only one value, so return it as the answer.
00421   if (pval_vec.size()==1) {
00422     *out_target=pval_vec[0];
00423   }
00424   // 
00425   else {
00426     // the order is ascending...
00427     sort(pval_vec.begin(),pval_vec.end());
00428     // so we need to invert per_cutoff
00429     //per_cut=1.0-per_cut;
00430     // now lookup the pvalue (and interpolate)
00431     double pos=per_cut*(probe_cnt-1);
00432     int    idx=(int)pos;
00433         
00434         if (GCCN_preprocessed == false)
00435                 *out_target=pval_vec[idx]+((pos-idx)*(pval_vec[idx+1]-pval_vec[idx]));
00436         else
00437                 *out_target = PercentileValue (pval_vec,probe_cnt,per_cut);
00438   }
00439 }

00441 /// @todo Turn these into ">>" and "<<" operators.

00443 void
00444 affx::Dabg::dabgfile_write(const std::string& filename)
00445 {
00446   std::fstream file;
00447 
00448   file.open(filename.c_str(),std::fstream::out);
00449   file << "# This is a dabg data file. Format: (bin[0-25] count \\n (value \\n)* \\n)*\n";
00450 
00451   for (int gcbin=0;gcbin<=AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX;gcbin++) {
00452     file << gcbin << "    " << data[gcbin].size() << "\n";
00453     int i_max=data[gcbin].size();
00454     for (int i=0;i<i_max;i++) {
00455       file << data[gcbin][i] << "\n";
00456     }
00457     file << "\n";
00458   }
00459     
00460   file.close();
00461 }

00463 
00464 void
00465 affx::Dabg::dabgfile_read(const std::string& filename)
00466 {
00467   std::fstream file;
00468   char line[1000];
00469 
00470   // zero out the contents
00471   clear(); 
00472 
00473   file.open(filename.c_str(),std::fstream::in);
00474   // discard first line of the file
00475   file.getline(line,sizeof(line));
00476 
00477   //
00478   int gcbin_in;
00479   int gcbin_size;
00480   float val;
00481   for (int gcbin=0;gcbin<=AFFYDABG_GC_COUNT_MAX;gcbin++) {
00482     file >> gcbin_in;
00483     assert(gcbin_in==gcbin);
00484     file >> gcbin_size;
00485     data[gcbin].reserve(gcbin_size);
00486     for (int i=0;i<gcbin_size;i++) {
00487       file >> val;
00488       data[gcbin].push_back(val);
00489     }
00490   }
00491 
00492   file.close();
00493 }
